page.title: 08FARMING IN THE AREA
page.content: In the Goldhanger area the most common crops are wheat, barley, sugar beet and oil seed rape. But the one which is grown most often is wheat. One farmer,named Mr Bunting of Highams farm, told us that years ago the Tiptree and Goldhanger area were the best places for growing crops because it is very good soil.But now it is not so good. There is a farm called Nursery farm and that has got a house with a garden and a big farm round the back. Some farms grow soft fruit like strawberries, rasberries, goosberries, mulberries and tomatoes. Some farms also grow vegetables like turnips, potatoes, peas and cabbages. Most of the fruit and vegetables are for pick your own.
